page.title: 02THE BOLLIN VALLEY PROJECT
page.content: The River Bollin flows through the east of Cheshire, it is 34 miles long. It is a small river and in other parts of England it would not be very important but over 2,000,000 people live only half an hours drive away from the Bollin. Many of these people want to picnic by and play in, look at, fish in, walk by and enjoy themselves in the river. All these visitors could annoy the farmers by making noise, dropping litter and walking on their land. The Bollin Valley Project was set up to help the public enjoy the Valley while not disturbing the farmers. There are full time and part time Rangers who put sign posts and stiles up, plant trees, answer visitors' questions and help people in many ways. by Andrew Beard and Matthew Burns.
